se.softhouse.jargo

Class ArgumentBuilder.ArityArgumentBuilder<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder<BUILDER,T>
      • se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder.ArityArgumentBuilder<T>
  • Enclosing class:
    ArgumentBuilder<SELF extends ArgumentBuilder<SELF,T>,T>

    @NotThreadSafe
public static final class ArgumentBuilder.ArityArgumentBuilder<T>
extends ArgumentBuilder<BUILDER,T>
    An intermediate builder used by ArgumentBuilder.arity(int) and ArgumentBuilder.variableArity(). It's mainly used to switch the T argument of the previous builder to List and to indicate invalid call orders.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class se.softhouse.jargo.ArgumentBuilder

        ArgumentBuilder.ArityArgumentBuilder<T>, ArgumentBuilder.CommandBuilder, ArgumentBuilder.DefaultArgumentBuilder<T>, ArgumentBuilder.MapArgumentBuilder<K,V>, ArgumentBuilder.OptionArgumentBuilder, ArgumentBuilder.RepeatedArgumentBuilder<T>, ArgumentBuilder.SplitterArgumentBuilder<T>

    • Method Detail

      • splitWith

        @Deprecated
public ArgumentBuilder.SplitterArgumentBuilder<List<T>> splitWith(String valueSeparator)
        Deprecated. 
         This doesn't work with ArgumentBuilder.arity(int) or ArgumentBuilder.variableArity()
 I.e --foo 1,2 3,4
 is currently unsupported
        Description copied from class: ArgumentBuilder
         When given a "," this allows for
 arguments such as:
 -numbers 1,2,3
 where the resulting List<Integer> would contain 1, 2 & 3.
 
 Doesn't allow empty lists.
        Overrides:
        splitWith in class ArgumentBuilder<ArgumentBuilder.ArityArgumentBuilder<T>,List<T>>
        Parameters:
        valueSeparator - the string to split the input with
        Returns:
        a new (more specific) builder
